paper_abstract: A finite volume turbulence model for the resolution of the two-dimensional shallow water equation,,, with turbulent term is presented. After making a finite volume discretization of the depth-averaged k-epsilon equations in conservative form, the q-r equations, that give stability to the process, are obtained. Wall and inlet boundary conditions for the turbulent equations and wall conditions for the hydrodynamic equations are discussed. A comparison between the k-epsilon and q-r models and some experimental results is made. Copyright (C) 2008 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Experimental validation of two depth-averaged turbulence models
